description: The TOSCA BlockStorage node currently represents a server-local block storage device (i.e., not shared) offering evenly sized blocks of data from which raw storage volumes can be created.

tosca_name.description: This attribute reflects the name of the Node Template as defined in the TOSCA service template. This name is not unique to the realized instance model of corresponding deployed application as each template in the model can result in one or more instances (e.g., scaled) when orchestrated to a provider environment.

state.description: The state of the node instance. See section “Node States” for allowed values.

tosca_id.description: A unique identifier of the realized instance of a Node Template that derives from any TOSCA normative type.

tosca.interfaces.node.lifecycle.Standard.description: This lifecycle interface defines the essential, normative operations that TOSCA nodes may support.

size.description: The requested storage size (default unit is MB). Note: - Required when an existing volume (i.e., volume_id) is not available. - If volume_id is provided, size is ignored.  Resize of existing volumes is not considered at this time.

volume_id.description: ID of an existing volume (that is in the accessible scope of the requesting application).

snapshot_id.description: Some identifier that represents an existing snapshot that should be used when creating the block storage (volume).

device.description: The logical device name which for the attached device (which is represented by the target node in the model). e.g., ‘/dev/hda1’ Note: this property will be moved in next releases to the AttachTo relationship as it is specified by TOSCA spec.

description: The TOSCA Database node represents a logical database that can be managed and hosted by a TOSCA DBMS node.

tosca_name.description: This attribute reflects the name of the Node Template as defined in the TOSCA service template. This name is not unique to the realized instance model of corresponding deployed application as each template in the model can result in one or more instances (e.g., scaled) when orchestrated to a provider environment.

state.description: The state of the node instance. See section “Node States” for allowed values.

tosca_id.description: A unique identifier of the realized instance of a Node Template that derives from any TOSCA normative type.

tosca.interfaces.node.lifecycle.Standard.description: This lifecycle interface defines the essential, normative operations that TOSCA nodes may support.

name.description: the logical name of the database

port.description: the port the underlying database service will listen to for data

user.description: the optional user account name for DB administration

password.description: the optional password for the DB user account

description: The TOSCA Network node represents a simple, logical network service.

tosca_name.description: This attribute reflects the name of the Node Template as defined in the TOSCA service template. This name is not unique to the realized instance model of corresponding deployed application as each template in the model can result in one or more instances (e.g., scaled) when orchestrated to a provider environment.

tosca.interfaces.node.lifecycle.Standard.description: This lifecycle interface defines the essential, normative operations that TOSCA nodes may support.

description: The TOSCA Compute node represents one or more real or virtual processors of software applications or services along with other essential local resources. Collectively, the resources the compute node represents can logically be viewed as a (real or virtual) “server”.

ip_address.description: The primary private IP address assigned by the cloud provider that applications may use to access the Compute node.

public_ip_address.description: The primary public IP address assigned by the cloud provider that applications may use to access the Compute node.

tosca_id.description: A unique identifier of the realized instance of a Node Template that derives from any TOSCA normative type.

tosca_name.description: This attribute reflects the name of the Node Template as defined in the TOSCA service template. This name is not unique to the realized instance model of corresponding deployed application as each template in the model can result in one or more instances (e.g., scaled) when orchestrated to a provider environment.

state.description: The state of the node instance. See section “Node States” for allowed values.

tosca.interfaces.node.lifecycle.Standard.description: This lifecycle interface defines the essential, normative operations that TOSCA nodes may support.

description: The TOSCA WebApplication node represents a software application that can be managed and run by a TOSCA WebServer node. Specific types of web applications such as Java, etc. could be derived from this type.

tosca_name.description: This attribute reflects the name of the Node Template as defined in the TOSCA service template. This name is not unique to the realized instance model of corresponding deployed application as each template in the model can result in one or more instances (e.g., scaled) when orchestrated to a provider environment.

state.description: The state of the node instance. See section “Node States” for allowed values.

tosca.interfaces.node.lifecycle.Standard.description: This lifecycle interface defines the essential, normative operations that TOSCA nodes may support.

context_root.description: The web application’s context root which designates the application’s URL path within the web server it is hosted on.

description: This TOSCA WebServer Node Type represents an abstract software component or service that is capable of hosting and providing management operations for one or more WebApplication nodes.

tosca_name.description: This attribute reflects the name of the Node Template as defined in the TOSCA service template. This name is not unique to the realized instance model of corresponding deployed application as each template in the model can result in one or more instances (e.g., scaled) when orchestrated to a provider environment.

description: The TOSCA SoftwareComponent node represents a generic software component that can be managed and run by a TOSCA Compute Node Type.

tosca_name.description: This attribute reflects the name of the Node Template as defined in the TOSCA service template. description: The TOSCA Load Balancer node represents logical function that be used in conjunction with a Floating Address to distribute an application’s traffic (load) across a number of instances of the application (e.g., for a clustered or scaled application).

tosca_name.description: This attribute reflects the name of the Node Template as defined in the TOSCA service template. This name is not unique to the realized instance model of corresponding deployed application as each template in the model can result in one or more instances (e.g., scaled) when orchestrated to a provider environment.

tosca.interfaces.node.lifecycle.Standard.description: This lifecycle interface defines the essential, normative operations that TOSCA nodes may support.

capabilities.description: the Floating (IP) client’s on the public network can connect to

requirements.description: Connection to one or more load balanced applications

description: The TOSCA Container Application node represents an application that requires Container-level virtualization technology.

description: This is the default (root) TOSCA Node Type that all other TOSCA nodes should extends. This allows all TOSCA nodes to have a consistent set of features for modeling and management (e.g, consistent definitions for requirements, capabilities, and lifecycle interfaces).

tosca_id.description: A unique identifier of the realized instance of a Node Template that derives from any TOSCA normative type.

This name is not unique to the realized instance model of corresponding deployed application as each template in the model can result in one or more instances (e.g., scaled) when orchestrated to a provider environment.

description: The TOSCA DBMS node represents a typical relational, SQL Database Management System software component or service.

root_password.description: the optional root password for the DBMS service

port.description: the port the DBMS service will listen to for data and requests

description: The TOSCA Container Runtime node represents operating system-level virtualization technology used to run multiple application services on a single Compute host.
